intro: Lampranthus edwardsiae, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its vibrant flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
